file_content.text: I demand to know what the lot of you are up to.
What transpires here that would have Sith assisting bounty hunters?
Hey. What's with the procession? And the Sith?
You. Stop. Tell me what's going on.
Grabbing a contract from the bounty broker. Sith's turning one in, believe it or not.
No assistance. Her bounty, fair and square. You could be doing the same, if it suited you.
Didn't hear? Love to know how you avoided the onslaught of holo-adverts. Lucky.
Headed to the broker. You know, the bounty broker? Guess you haven't heard.
The Bounty Brokers Association is taking all comers now. Limited-time-offer sort of thing.
Some non-Cartel Hutts run the BBA, but the whole promotion's endorsed by the Empire. To them, the BBA helps take out the trash.
These Sith and whatnot think it's easy, what we do. You ought to pitch in--help us proper hunters prove them wrong.
Sounds like it could make for a fun distraction.
Consider me intrigued.
This isn't exactly my line of work. Why should I bother?
I'm no bounty hunter.
Do the bounties have to be delivered alive?
I prefer killing to capturing.
Why've I never heard of any Bounty Brokers Association before?
What's this "Association"?
Maybe the Great Hunt winner's already got a full plate? Yeah--I know who you are.
Beats me. Heard of them now, right?
Profitable, too. Some of these bounties are impressive scum--way beyond run-of-the-mill.
Notoriety? Travel? Credits? Get your hands on some defiant scum? All sound like good reasons to me.
Carbonite or casket--long as you can prove the deed, either's acceptable.
Hutts own and operate the Association. No longer Cartel affiliated, if that's important to you.
The BBA's set up shop in the fleet. Chat up one of their brokers--they'll get you approved and ready to hunt.
